title: Keeper scores amazing stoppage-time goal
title_page: Keeper scores amazing stoppage-time goal | Daily Mail Online
text:
This is the video of a late winning goal like no other - straight from the goalkeeper's boot in his own penalty area.
Argentine Matias Dituro kicked the ball the full length of the pitch, watching it fly into the opposition's net to secure three points five minutes into injury time.
Dituro, keeper for Bolivian team Bolivar of La Paz, left rival goalkeeper Carlos Franco scrambling and bewildered.
Bolivar goalkeeper Matias Dituro jumps to collect the ball from a corner in the final seconds
Wasting no time at all, Dituro runs to the edge of the box and kicks the ball as hard as he can
The opposing goalkeeper Carlos Franco could only watch as the ball flew over his head
The opposing keeper had been in Dituro's area trying to help San Jose de Oruro grab a late equaliser with Bolivar wining 2-1.
And Dituro took full advantage, grabbing an amazing goal to settle the match and win the the 12th Annual Bolivian Open Football Tournament for his side.
'I was the first one to be surprised with that goal,' Dituro admitted afterwards. 'It was also important for us to win the game against the strong pressure of San Jose.'
The wonder strike flew for virtually 100 yards before taking a few bounces into the net, much to the astonishment of the opposition defence â€“ with their keeper still in the opposition half of the pitch.
No defenders could get near the ball as it raced into the net to extend Bolivar's lead to 3-1
Bolivar's players congratulate Dituro after watching his shot travel the length of the pitch
The manager couldn't believe what he was seeing as his side won the tournament in Bolivia
The local press heaped praise on Dituro, exclaiming, 'Goalkeeper Matias Dituro of Bolivar had the stadium in his pocket when he scored from goal to goal.'
And the sensational shot-stopper has history with being a goal king having scored in November 2015 when he played for the 'Pumas,' notching a late equaliser against Santiago Wanderers.
Bolivar are currently sitting top of the table of the Bolivian League with 28 points.
